Customer experience  Most customers greeted by the Purser on ground.  All customers offered their menu after take off by the Purser.  All customers received their meals as per their preferences.  For a load of 13 customers, we were short of 7 sleepers on this sector.

Crew Compliment      Professional behaviour    CCM  Ram Keshav Murthy During briefing Ivan came early and was very , friendly, approachable, polite and pleasant and volunteered to take pictures on board and to provide the children with toys during boarding. After completing JC service he went to help YC without being asked to do so. He interacted with customers throughout the flight, welcoming back our HV customers and also bidding them farewell before landing. He showed care to an elderly couple  of Chinese descent who didn't speak English. He communicated with them in mandarin, showing them how to use the ICE system and explaining the seat functions. Ivan was pleasant and hard working and  willing to offer his help to all colleagues in all cabins and with customers as well. It was  a great pleasure having him on board and as part of my team and I wish him very well in his career path with Emirates.

CREW PERFORMANCE    Cabin Crew, Karim Zaki s446490, was observed for his professionalism and customer service,  Zaki noticed a customer who was celebrating his birthday while completing the Landing card, our dearly customer was invited to the aft galley by Zaki, where drinks of his choice were offered and the on board camera was used,   Moreover, Zaki ensured that every crew member would sign and write a few words for our customer to make the moment more memorable for him,   Crew Member was, furthermore, observed to have a very nice tone of voice while doing the Arabic PA, seniors on board were very pleased by his professionalism.
First Class Customer Experience     Overall First Class customer experience achieved for all customers  No comments or complaints received

Great customer service skills while under pressure.Due to a 7hr delay and non priority boarding given to J class all customers were very upset and were quite vocal about how the felt. Harriet kept a positive manner and smiled throughout the flight making sure all customers felt well looked after and care for.Customers left the flight happy.

Dear Amelita, I just flew with one of your shining stars: Christina, 412118.Christina did a great job in building Personal relationships with our F/C customers, anticipating their needs and looking for opportunity to go beyond.She helped Y/C CSV by looking after the flight deck throughout the flight.  Christina also displayed great teamwork. On all sectors, she volunteered to help her colleagues in both J/C and Y/C. Her help was much appreciated for without it, we would not have been able to take our legal rest. Christina is a joy to work with. She is very professional and friendly.
14 f.c customer feedbackAll customers including Io disembarked happy.

during the flight Teresia demonstrated great galley organisation. she labelled all the clearance drawers in order for the Crew to organise the dirty crockery and cutlery,she had attended the Catering tour and had resolved to ensure that crockery and everything is packed well. she was consistent with It for Both sectors.  she was observed taking over the boarding while I worked on the CMT  we had two Failed attempts to land  into GLA  I Shared a NITS briefing with the Crew for landing into NCL  Crew were calm and asked questions for clarification  all the Crew shows resilience on this sectors customers were on borad as this time while on ground Teresia took initiative to offer F class customers drinks she assisted her colleagues by collecting all the left over juices from J class and F class and handed It to them  she was composed and  smiling and explaining to customers.

Stefan display confident and professional image At all times.  he always prepare for the service in advance to ensure a smooth flow in service   he is also always calm and compose as he knows exactly what he was doing. for example, assisting me to dismantle the carts in the galley and not rushing to take the clearance cart as most Customer still eating At the Aft.  he is an Excellent team player always assisting his colleagues and very considerate towards colleagues for example pouring glasses of water for Crew before and after service he is very proactive for example taking his own initiative to do the Catering check  for me when he realise that I was busy with boarding.  Stefan moves around the Economy cabin assisting his colleagues with luggages to be placed in hatrack.

Tilted cart During service, while getting a new meal cart in the cabin , Monika tilted the cart side ways resulting in the cart falling on the galley floor. Monika stated that she did not suffer any injuries and she does not know how she managed to tilt it but the weight of the cart over powered her. The cart breaks were released prior to the incident. None of the crew present in the galley were injured.

777 2 class fwd bulkhead wall designOn the 777 2 class (even the latest additions to the fleet, like this registration) the bulkhead wall behind PVS 1AB DEF J and K is still upholstered with the very old (and very out dated if I may add) green ish burl wood design, a heritage from when we still had the old F/C skycruiser seats (and recliner F seats)  and non flat J seats. Even though the galley side of said wall is updated with the neutral grey pallet we see on modern first class galleys and social area's.The PVS honey brown burl wood screen covers clash wih the green wall decor

All the way during the flight internet wasn't working.  Some customers could log in and some customers wore not permitted to log in. The accept button wasn't able to be clicked on

Channel 94 does not display Connecting Gates     The connecting gate channel 94 never displays the gates.   The only information provided is the flight number, destination and departure time.  Several customers keep commenting that the actual departure gate is not displayed on this channel.  From previous flights it has been observed that channel 94 never displays the connecting gates.  It would enhance the customer experience to add the connecting gates to this channel.   Without this information channel 94 is not having any value to our customers.
We had some problems with the lighting in both FAP's. Many lighting functions where showing faulty when selected.

Wi Fi log on options enhancement     Two customers were approaching crew to assist them logging on to the Onair network.  One Gold member was not aware of his Skywards Account password and had to search in his documents first. He stated that it is not very convenient to have only this log on option especially that many travel agencies are booking tickets for customers.  An other customer mentioned that added her Skywards number to her reservation which could not be identified on the KIS Tablet. Therefore she was not able to make use of the complimentary Wi Fi.  She was disappointed that she could only use 20MB free of charge.  Suggestion: Offering customers different log on options (i.e. Seat number and last name) would increase the customer satisfaction.

IFE (sorry, I could not find any drop down menu on KIS regarding IFE feedback, kindly fwd to IFE IT)Before when IFE screens that were not in use (especially the larger and thus brighter ones in premium cabins) would automatically switch off after a certain set time, e.g. unoccupied seats.Lately I've noticed that screens (especially the latest IFE screens which are much brighter than previous versions) remain on ICE home page for the duration of the flightconsequence: On night flights these screens light op the cabin (unless individually switched off by the crew) disturbing (premium) neighbouring customers trying to sleep The life span and quality of a screen is reduced when a picture stays the same for hours on end

FEEDBACK ON FC INTERIOR ON THE FULL HEIGHT SUITE B7771. Sunset scenario on CMS finishes with dimmed blue lights on the ceiling, it doesn't go to fully dark, unlike the other B777 FC.2. The lights in the individual suits can't be fully switched off, neither from the Light Control Panel or Mode Controller Docking Station Buttons   all lights do go off except for the ceiling light which always stays on, although very dimmed, however this may be an issue for come customers who prefer total darkness in their suite.3. As per the On board update   the lights for boarding for individual suites should be set to orange. This however can only be done manually, individually from each suite. CMS gives the option of mood lighting for the cabin only, not for the suites (different options are available for the temperature though    separately for the cabin and suites, respectively). Special meals sticker error    If customer order special meal for himself and baby meal for infant, mistake will occur while printing special meal stickers.  Mistake occurs because first meal next to customer's name is always BBML  eg: Mr. X     BBML, AVML  Instead special meal ordered by the customer, special meal sticker is going to show BBML ordered for infant with customer's name.  This can cause confusion and special meal not delivered to customer.  When stickers are printed it is done by groups: all VGML stickers are going to be printed next to each other, and all others special meals as well. When this mistake occur BBML is not printed in sequence with other BBML's but inserted between other meals: eg AVML 17B, BBML 21C, AVML 25D....

Unable to serve hot beverages during Breakfast service due to turbulence      As per captain's recommendation, decision was made not to serve any hot liquids during the breakfast service.

Customer were complaining that its very cold and they need more blanked. Temperature was monitored and met for customer comport. Some customer still were cold and asked for more blanket which we didn't have as it was full.

YC recommend service Service on the flight was Bar with biscuits and meal cart with drinks drawer for lunch and light bite before landing.  Customer informed us that they were hungry and have to wait for hot meals after the bar service.  The flight was less than a block time by 50 minute for 7 hours flight.

During the last service I decided to deliver last two carts, from the aft galley backwards from the last row, 88, towards the front. Reason for this decision is to give customers that were seated at the back of the AC, the choice to get their proffered m
No water couplets.Due to a very busy and demanding boarding no water couplets were able to be completed.Due to a very busy service they also could not be completed after take off.

DELAY TO START OF Y/CLASS SERVICE There was a minor delay of approx 15 20 mins to the start of the Y/Class service after take off. Due to some forecast turbulence it was not deemed practical to commence the service until such time as this forecast had been cleared. SSQ notes require service to start after take off, being the only service on this sector due to catering issues in CPH and return catering carried on board.
Customer stated that the meal served in Y( Chicken Paela )class is not a Pakistani dish.

Customer complaint of not having butter on his tray  none of the trays had butter.  customer explained he does this sector very often and expected to have butter as part of his tray  no butter loaded in crew cart either
: DRINK REQUEST: The crew were very busy with drink request of whisky, beer and wine: It would be very nice if we have bar cart following meal cart with drawers on the top.

Y/CLASS MENU/SERVICE CHANGE DUE TO CPH STATION CATERING ISSUES As per flight instructions for this trip, menus were not to be loaded due to service change and cancellation of breakfast service. This is due to catering issues In CPH and requirement to carry return catering from DXB, hence breakfast service is cancelled. However, menus still mention breakfast service availability. It was found that menus were still loaded for the flight. Menus stipulated availability of breakfast service despite only lunch service being available.

~Time Constraint~ Preparations were done on ground for service. Released for service 20 minutes after take off. 74 special meal deliveries. Received the call for 20 to top while all carts were in the cabin still delivering meals. Available crew from other cabins came assist. and took another 20 minutes to complete delivery.

Hot beverage not completed    Due to the long lasting moderate turbulence, hot beverages were not offered from bar carts. When the turbulence was ceased and seat belt sign had been switched off for about 5 minutes, Green tea was offered by hand from FWD of Economy cabin to LR4 doors, however we encountered another turbulence and crew were instructed to take their seats. Turbulence lasted till top of decent, and the hot beverages were not completed.
Pre departure service had been done after take off as we were informed by the purser that it would be short taxi.
Customer swapped the seat by himself once the aircraft door closed. he told the Crew he wanted more space next to him.

due to delivery of special meal trays by Hand breakfast service took more that 1:43 minutes. during top of descent clearance carts were present in the cabin. towels before landing were not Offered to customers.
Insufficient supply of sugar in economy   Need an extra bag of sugar Sugar highly demanded by customer's profile on this flight
Bar service   No pretzels    As there was only 3/4 box of pretzels on board for the entire YC, no pretzels done with bar service.
Wrong menus  crew has accidentally distributed EZE GIG menus for pre departure.  I only realised after take off.

Unable to serve Second round Tea/Coffee    Due to moderate turbulence in between 8.36 am and 8.52 am it was unable to be served Tea/Coffee by hand as crew needed to be seated however Tea/Coffee were served before as part of the service bar (breakfast service).
Due to turbulence all economy crew were seated in the middle of the service for 35 minutes.
Hot towels  hot towels were not done before landing as the last service (hot breakfast)  took longer than expected (a large number of special meals).

We care service could not be done due to turbulence.The first part of we care cleanliness was done 1815 to 1830.The second and third part of we care cycle was not done from 1830to 1900.Seatbelt sign remained on from 1700 to 2000.
Hot towels service before landing was not commenced due to time restriction.  Breakfast service was commenced 01 hour and 45 minutes before TOD.

Towels were not done for descent (pre landing) as breakfast service finished on top of descent.   We were instructed to prioritize securing as we were landing straight in 15 mins and that there is no fog.
Customer Complaining of Non organized service   Customers in a general way, complained that the service was displaying being disorganized of bar service and Meal service without bars.

Timetable booklet not available      On our flight there was no time table book available in economy, business or first class;  Several customers were asking about their connecting flight and about the time of their next flight to their destination;  Customer could not be provided with the information necessary as there was no timetable;  Several cabin crew commented that the booklet does not exist anymore and was discontinued;   Y Prod and Service manual reads: timetable available in amenities in drawer 1;

Safety and security searches Due to late pulled out of the cabin crew assigned to UL2 position the safety and security searches were conducted by the Purser after completing own respective area. Crew arrived to the aircraft during boarding

4 D's implemented on flight    Due to excessive consumption of alcohol rule of 4D's was implemented on Mr Blajthy.

INTOXICATED CUSTOMER  After take off, customer asked for a beer. Crew Ondrej observed that the customer was slurring in speech and smelled of alcohol. When asked if he had alcoholic prior to the flight, customer stated that he had alcoholic drinks in the airport. Customer was asking beer after another and was asking his friends to order beer for him.

SERVICE OF ALCOHOL WAS DELAYED     After take off, Mrs Harper claimed that she was scared of flying and started shaking. She claimed also that she was having a family issues. After few drinks, Mrs Harper started crying while seated in the lounge, and was very slow in responding  .

Intoxicated behaviour  Ms. Dignam could not walk straight and she was mumbling when she talked during boarding. when I spoke to her to get information, There was No alcohol smell. pax stated that she was very tired and she could not see clearly due to No contact lenses.

ACCUSATION AGAINST ANOTHER PASSENGER   MR YOUSEF 87A.   Shortly after take off Mr Clarke approached the CSV at the forward Y/C galley asking to speak to the highest person in charge   He claimed that he and his wife felt very uncomfortable seated next to the man in 87A as he "was conducting in criminal activity".   He stated the reason for this was due to him having three phones all with pictures of women on them with passport copies.  He and his wife stated they could read the messages whereby he was offering them money, flights etc.  He stated "he's involved in human trafficking or prostitution.  He asked me if the police in the UK could do anything once they got home.  He also asked what could be done about it in Dubai
Customer let his child sleep on the floor.  When instructed to use baby bassinet or hold his baby, he claimed that on previous flights he was allowed to do so.

Customer failed to comply with instructions and tried to touch crew member After the captain had switched on the seatbelt sign for arrival into ISB crew member Veljko was secuing his area of the cabin, he knocked on the lav door by R3 several times and Mr Adnan opened abruptly and said he needed to use the bathroom Veljkon politely told the customer he was having to secure the cabin in order to pass the checks to the captain, Mr Adnan eventually returned to his seat after a prolonged amount of time on the lav During cabin securing Mr Adnan was asked 3 times to put on his seat belt by Vejklo as he was continually failing to comply and as the crew members were about to be seated he requested water, however it was explained to him that as we were about to land this would not be possible After landing Mr Adnan approached Adnan and reached for his ID in an abrupt and threatening manner  Purser Alyssa was standing by and saw this and asked Mr Adnan not to touch crew member

VERBAL ABUSIVE. customer moved to sit on 16K which was not his original seat. During the bar service when the crew were taking his order, they could not understand him. He turned to the customer seated on 16H and told her "F... them." During the Breakfast service he told the male crew Arabic crew  (Hafez) that he wanted to have the "Halal pork." Customer appeared disturbed and not coherent or aware of his surrounding. At one point he was talking to himself loudly and the customer in front of him asked him to keep quiet. He refused to show us his boarding pass after the incident and so we could not find his original seat or even get his details. It was very difficult for the crew and myself to understand what he was saying as he was mumbling a lot and was incoherent.

CONSIDER ALLOWANCE RE EVALUATION      This was my first time in the hotel since the finishing of the refurbishment   There is no longer a 50% discount at the restaurant, instead it is 35% with a forced 12.5% service charge for eating in. However if you buy from the deli to takeaway there is no discount  Room service remains at only 10% discount  This will have been my 82nd time to Heathrow and it is now not possible to eat in for the respective meals within the allowance.

Most of the crew, including myself, did not receive information about delayed flight and was around an an hour earlier for the pickup.  in addition, feedback from the crew suggest that the condition in this hotel do not fulfil min terms for 4 star hotel

Feedback   MURCURE HOTEL on Stevens, Singapore    The hotel for all crew in Singapore changed to MURCURE ON STEVENS, since end of December 2017. The rooms allocated for all crew, except CAPT and First officer, was found to be extremely small and compact. There was no table available to keep your belongings, to have a meal or to work on. There wasn't any designated space or stand/stool for suitcase, thus it had to be left on the floor, which took away the little space available to walk around the bed. The bathrooms were very small and compact. It was quite difficult to find a space to keep your toiletries as there was no counter top in the bathrooms. At least 6 crew, including my self, did not have hot water in the shower or wash basin taps. Internet services, thus not considered essential, but helps to complete any left over reports and VRs from flight, was very poor and kept disconnecting on and off.

Crew arrived in the hotel (Fire and Ice) and almost 15 rooms are not yet cleaned.  This includes the room for flight deck crew.  Crew only found out when they reached there rooms.  Reception had no idea about it.  Please note that EK 721 was an early mo
Room Temperature    Rooms were extremely hot during our stay, and it was impossible to turn off the heater.

LATE CHECKIN FOR EK 336 CREW  Crew arrived in the hotel at 0615 and the 02 Capt, FO and Purser were the 1st to sign and few grade 2. 04 crew name that was given the last rooms and the time the room was givenEmily 386323 room was given at 0730Yanmin 45459

The air conditioning in the hotel it was not working properly. It was set for 18 degrees but it never got below 24 degrees during the layover, witch made it very hard to sleep and rest before the flight.

Crew arrived in morning after a full night of flying, and had to wait 45 min to get a room. When we finally got a room, no room keys was working, and everyone had to return to reception with suitcases to get new key. Not acceptable and happened before in same hotel

CREW FEEDBACK.  room was very small  no place to put suitcase, had to store on chair  no desk or table for sitting, eating or storage of items  no space in bathroom for placing toiletries/makeup, had to use closed toilet  room was not clean, had hair in bathroom Myself vey noisy I was woken up serval times by crew check in /check out so disturbed rest. rooms so close together so can hear every thing.

Noise in the hotel   New hotel is situated at the airport. Hotel is next to the runway. Some crew complained about the noise. Depending on the side of the hotel, aircraft taking off and landing caused disturbance to the rest of some crew.
Crew rest disturbed @ Mecure on Stevens Singapore  Crew with rooms close to lifts complaint of noise  Walls are thin and conversations from next room could be heard
Two crew fell sick during the flight with vomiting and diarrhoea.The Captain also felt unwell but was fit to operate the flight.

Noisy Hotel    This Report is raised concerning the Majority of the crew. Most rooms are noisy towards the outside and the inside. Noise insulation ineffective. Crew rest is vital for the fitness of operation.

REQUEST FOR REVIEW OF WAKE UP AND PICK UP TIMINGS  Wake up call for this sector was 0300LT for pick up at 0400LT. The bus did depart on time, but arrived at the terminal building on the arrivals floor and dropped off the crew at approximately 0435LT. A 10 minute walk (approximately) after offloading of baggage from the drop off point to the check in counters. The crew went directly to the boarding gates but the first of whom only reached the gate at approximately 0500LT after clearing security and immigration. We were allowed onto the aircraft, and completed the briefing and cleaning checks at approximately 0513LT. Boarding clearance was given at 0528LT. We managed to complete an expedited boarding by 0554LT.
during my stay in Frankfurt my hotel room was very noisy due to the construction where my window was facing, my room was also very hot despite having the A/C on 17 degrees.

On arrival (aprox 1am) we were informed there would be no hot water the following day between 0700 and 1400.However we had no hot water from any taps, showers, baths for the whole of the next day.Each crew had taken a cold shower before the flight except for one crew who had no water at all from his shower. He only had water from the sink faucet.

Hotel feedback       Most of the crew shared that if requesting any service, room service, housekeeping or any other, either the request was forgotten, or delivered approximately one hour later.  The food ordered like meat or fish, were off, smelly.  Overall cleanliness in the room was not satisfactory, hair here and there, towels not reflecting clean, dark not white enough.  The air condition in most of the room was not working well.  Equipment not available in the room or broken, e.g: telephone not working, shower broken, or the handle of the shower not available, the place of it is there though, socket plug cracked, which electrolysed when touched.  The housekeeper were noisy, slamming doors, and talking to each other from one building to another building, from around 7 a.m., and throughout the day.  The hotel staff in general not friendly.

AIRCONDITION   REST DISRUPTION  The air conditioning system of the hotel was  not cooling the room.  Unable to sleep since the room temperature was at 23 Degrees.  Hotel engineer further confirmed that the air coming out of the vents were also at 23 degrees  Unable to open windows as it is very noisy outside due to the room being on the 3rd floor and also next to the airport.  Was unable to get proper sleep due to the uncomfortable heat level in the room.

Wake up call not given   This is to bring to your attention that that only 04 crew members out of 31 crew member group did not receive any wake up call . ( 1230 local ).    Called on the hotel reception at 1240 only to be told that they were on the process of giving the wake up call to all crew members, and informed me that I will be receiving my wake up call shortly.  I never did receive a wake up call following up with the reminder that I did, nor an apology from the staff member nor the hotel management.

NO COFFEE/TEA FACILITIES  In Sheraton there is no tea/coffee amenities in room,  In crew lounge there is a pay machine for coffee which only accepts card however credit card cannot be used (hotel provides code vouchers or staff is deducted from per diem card   other airlines),  Once asked hotel reception for method of payment, hotel staff informed Emirates crew cannot purchase coffee in crew lounge as machine does not accept credit card and only direct per diem deduction,   Since there are no facilities in room and crew lounge has only coffee through pay machine which does not accept pesos bills or credit card it makes it inconvenient to have a simple cup of coffee,  As per my experience this is the only hotel which does not have such facilities, which are beneficial prior a flight when one wants to have some caffeine to ensure alertness,  Several cabin crew complained about issue.

I would like to pass on some of the feedback received by the crew and my self included after our stay at the the Protea Hotel Ikeja in Lagos.  Each one received only one shower towel. There is no face towel as well as a bath mat to use after the shower. Thef floor is very slippery and can became an hazard.  No light inside one of the crew bathroom (room 246).  Towel holder in room 201 was broken.Room needs more maintenance

Room service timings Room service at the hotel starts at 6 am to 1pm and from 5 pm to 12 am.  During lunch time and after midnight, if the crew wanted to eat something, no rom service was available.  On this flight, Crew are coping with different time zone and sleeping patterns  not having room service available 24 hours is is not convenient for the crew.

Feedback regarding the new crew hotel   Mercure      Hotel rooms are extremely small, with no space for a work desk to complete KIS reports or do any work before/after the flight.  Toilet bidet is literally less than half a meter away from the shower box which makes sitting at the bidet and standing from it inconvenient with a chance to hit the shower box glass frame.  On check out, there was only 1 staff at the reception trying to attend to Hotel residents and cabin crew, check out took a long time.  Other crew reported some maintenance issues i.e. no water in the showers, door lock was broken and room door couldn't be locked.  Singapore destination is one of the few destinations in EK network where premium cabins are always booked and full before Economy cabin and is a very profitable route for EK.

Disturbing phone calls in the night  It was reported by 3x Cabin Crew that they were woken at approx. 2am by phone calls to their hotel rooms  The calls seemed to be pre recorded messages like automated wake up calls  Rooms affected were 503, 504, 449
Hotel room was quite hot as the AC didn't work properly.  Due to the high temperature in the room I couldn't have a proper rest for my flight specially because it was already a really short layover.
Attention Corporate Communications           Please note that while checking in and checking out of Ramada Hotel Multan, it was noticed that Hotel staff were taking pictures of crew in uniform.

No wake up call received All crew reported that no wake up call was received at 16:50. Several crew including the captain and myself called the front desk to see if the flight had been delayed however they said the system had not delivered the message as usual. At 17:00 I called and they said they were calling everyone's rooms manually. At pick up several crew reported they still has not received a wake up call.

Mercure Hotel in Singapore the room is very small and does not have table for laptops or workstation.  There is also no room to store my suitcase and cabin bag. The only place (at the foot of the bed) obstructed my access and is a tripping hazard.   The

Insufficient allowance for breakfast Breakfast allowance given was 11 dollars. Hotel does not provide buffet breakfast, only ala carte. An egg dish with sausages cost about 13 dollars. This does not include bread basket, tea coffee. For example, if crew member wants an egg dish, a bread basket, tea or coffee it cost about 18 dollars after the discount, and room service will cost more than that as it includes 4 dollars delivery charge, 25 percent of tax resulting in crew paying about 22 dollars average for breakfast.  hotel staff explained during low season they do not provide buffet breakfasts

REST DISRUPTED  Crew members including flight deck had their rest disrupted from noise by house keepers and other hotel guests prior to wake up call / check out.  The Air conditioning system in the rooms were also noisy making it difficult to sleep prior to the flight.
Airport hotel in SFO, noisy due constant aircraft movements. Poor sound proofing obviously. I can even hear the guy coughing next door.

This feedback has been reported by all the crew on EK404 departed from Dubai on the 19th of January      The hotel rooms are very small with no space for our bags. It was very difficult to leave the room without squeezing past everything. The menu choice and room service was very poor with limited options to choose from.  After 10pm, no food outlets are opened apart from the room service, neither at the hotel nor in the vicinity.  The room doors are very stiff and you have to push them very hard in order to close them properly. The AC does not work properly and very hard to manipulate. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and very polite.

The Mercure Hotel on Stevens doesn't have the facilities to accommodate us :1) New Hotel in Singapore doesn't provide enough space for arriving Crew.Two sets of crew were arriving at the same time, it was chaotic during check in and the amount of crew were blocking all the elevators. The lobby of the hotel is not big enough,  hotel guests were clearly disturbed and annoyed by us 2) The power on the 4th floor went off 2 hours before the wake up call , making the room full bright , a loud recorded emergency message was playing for 20minutes, after that a flashing light was apparent in the room    it took 1,5 hours for staff/ maintenance to fix the issuesVideos of proof can be provided on demand3) The walls of the room are very thin and you can hear all noises around, leading to no possibility of good rest for upcoming flights.4) Got the wakeup call 5 times , I had to keep the phone handle up busy so i don't receive wakeup calls anymore .

Frankfurt Holiday Inn   Wake up call 17:25 (loud noise)  Crew members complaint about the airplane's take off noise. ROOMS NOT CLEANED  16 members of the crew after getting the keys and entering their rooms found out that they were not cleaned from previous occupant  Among them the Captain and the first officer  They were all relocated to a different room  1 of the new rooms was already occupied by another guest  5 of the crew had the cleaners entering their rooms without knocking and questioned if they were in the right room  Please contact CP Mark Rubery if you need evidences as he took pictures

No hot water  About nine crew member informed that they didn't have hot water in their room. All had to take cold shower / cold shave. Upon checking with the hotel staff at the time of checkout upon what was the reason, the staff didn't care, in fact rolled their eyes and said we do not know what happened, you all should have informed us earlier about the issue so that we could fix it on time, we got to know about the issue once you all told us. Its winter in Copenhagen with the temperature of  1 in the day time. there is a possibility crew might fall sick due to cold shower.

Meal allowances must be updated for Accra, it is insufficient to have 3 normal meals with the allowance given.From the room service menu the cheapest salad is 47.5GHC after discount, the cheapest burger is 42.5GHC after discount, and breakfast is 18GHC at a fixed rate for EK crew. The room provided to the purser in the Mercure hotel in Singapore is not up to standard.The room is very small, with very limited space to keep our baggage. when we arrived to the reception, the receptionist told us they have a different list of names (different set of Crew) and allowance can be given only wAfter the list was received from Dubai. BREAKFAST ALLOWANCE  The Breakfast allowance is 10.00 USD.  The hotel offers only a la carte and in room dining options for Breakfast.  My average order daily amounted to 15.00 USD (30.00 USD before discount). Most colleagues that I asked about, exceeded the Breakfast allowance by minimum 2.00 to 5.00 USD.  Please consider increasing the allowance for Breakfast.

Marriott San Francisco  Hotel room service operates on set times and is closed from 2pm to 6pm and from 11pm to 6am.  With a 12 hour time difference and timings of flight most crew are awake during the night and no food or beverages are available.  There is also no shops within walking distance around the hotel.  I tried ordering room service as after the flight I had rested and had to wait from midnight to 6 am to get anything, this is unacceptable for all crew during there layovers on such different timings and long duty times.  Also to order anything from the hotel and sign for, for example; room service, a charge of 150dollars is taken from your credit card not just blocked like in some other countries.

32 Life Jackets stowage's defective/ Delay 20 minutes     Once crew arrived at the aircraft, security Trans Guard officer reported to purser that he contacted engineers regarding 32 life jacket defective stowage's.  All stowage's were missing covers with tampered seals broken, upper deck business class cabin.  Purser shared with captain actual happening, engineers reminded about defects via the cockpit call  60 to ATD, dispatcher confirmed timing. The company/contractor that conducts the security searches ex EWR prior to us, has fallen under a vital shortfall.When the crew team boarded the aircraft there were still cleaners and the security team onboard.Few minutes later the security team disembarked leaving onboard 2 of the cleaners.When I asked them if they had finished the supervisor answered that they had finished indeed.The last 2 cleaners disembarked the aircraft 12 minutes after the security team.So my question was : "how did the security contractor had completed their security searches even way before the cleaners had left the aircraft?", "what is the point of their search then".

ITEMS LEFT IN 2 SEAT POCKETS AFTER HER SECURITY SEARCHES IN R3 AREA     During my cabin walk around whilst crew conducted their safety/security searches I spotted a head set plastic wrapper and a used ear plug in 2 seat pockets in her area  The plastic

I found white seals unsealed in one of the economy class bar cart. It is not the first time I found white seals on board, sometimes just on the galley top or on the floor. Since we are instructed to not break white seals out of Dubai, I think there is a security issue because anyone can put anything inside a container and close it back with a white seal and cabin crew won't even open it during security search out of Dubai.We should either be instructed to break all seals out of Dubai, or those white seals shouldn't be left behind for anyone to find and use.

Offload customer as lost wallet.Upon push back Mr Alsarraj told crew he wanted to be offloaded as he had left his wallet at Costa Coffee at airport terminal.During board Mr Alsarraj informed crew he had left his wallet at Costa Coffee.We asked ground staff to look and they said they called their colleagues and nothing had been handed in.We told Mr Alsarraj that his wallet had not been found. We explained the procedure for lost and found passenger items at airport.Hovered after thinking about this situation, 2 minutes after pushback Mr Alsarraj said he had to stay in Dubai as all his money and bank cards were in wallet and in Bahrain he had no money.Mr Alsarraj said he definately has to get off the aircraft and stay in Dubai.I informed Captain and he contacted control and explained situation.We returned back to stand and customer offloaded.Initial push back at 21:282nd push back at 22:02.No complaints experienced.

It was observed that customers are charged $1 more than the price listed in the DF magazine for most items when paying with USD.  This applies to the perfumes, jewellery, and watches tested on this flight, but only some accessories.For example: Customer requests item 802 and wants to pay in USD.  When entered into the HHC and converted, the    Subcategory Not applicable   HHC says this item will cost $61, as listed in the magazine.  However, once the payment screen 'P' is accessed and USD is selected as currency, the price becomes $62, which is what the customer would be charged.This discrepancy could lead to customer dissatisfaction and perhaps even legal consequences should it be noticed.

1.There were 03 EK IFE Engineers working in F/C while on the ground in DXB.2.They informed me that there are technical issues with the handset remote controllers of 3A ,1F and 1K suites.3.All those suites were occupied by IO Customers.4.The engineers did their best to rectify the technical fault with the handset remote controls of the above mentioned suites however were unable to fix them before the customer boarding.5.The Engineers informed me that the Company was aware of the issue and the IO department management has been advised accordingly.6.All other seat functions were fully operational.7.The customers were able to use Mode Controller and On Screen Display to control all suite/seat functions that were available on the handset remote control.8.None of the IO customers raised any concern with the handset control being inop.

J/CLASS DISEMBARKATION AT REMOTE STAND. (A380 2/Class HD) Please be advised that I have noted that on occasion, at a remote stand, J/Class customers on a 2/class A380 HD aircraft are required to disembark via the aft stairs down to ML5 door with J/class bus positioned at the base of the steps near ML5. My concern is that given the size and spiral of the stairs, and with customers carrying their hand luggage down that there is a safety hazard, potentially leading to a passenger injury. Elderly customers may experience greater difficulties in this respect.

Safe Talk. Crew member Vladislava415153 failed to answer first two questions of the safe talk correctly and had to be asked a third one which she finally answered after taking some time to think. After the briefing was over she informed me and the purser after all the crew left the briefing room that she felt pressurized during the safe talk and very uncomfortable and had teary eyes while informing us about the same. She also added that I should have asked her a aircraft specific question. The three questions asked were:1. What documents must be completed following birth on board?2. When should oxygen be administered for a casualty suffering from an asthma attack?3. What are the signs and symptoms of food poisoning? Vladislava was clearly not prepared for her safe talk and took a lot of time and prompting to answer them. She was also not very confident while answering any of the questions.

Brandy glass placed on First class' social area top shelf broken from turbulence It is First class service standard to have one brandy glass in the middle of the top shelf of the Social area, along with a bottle of Brandy and Chivas. During the flight, there was a turbulence. The crew shut the shelf door. Due to turbulence, Brandy bottle fell and hit the glass, causing it to break into many tiny pieces all over the social area. The crew had to climb up to clean up the debris, which could have caused injury if the crew did not close the social area door. Suggestion to remove brandy glass out of the social area as this incident takes place often.

Customer asked crew if she could use her own CPAP machine, crew member did not know that she wanted it plugged into the electrical socket at her seat as the machine did not have at batteries.As I walked by I observed that passenger wanted to plug it into the electrical socket of the aircraft, I advised customer that the device has to work off batteries and may not be plugged into the electrical socket of the aircraft.Customer claimed that this she was allowed to use it on all her previous flights and that no one has ever told her she may not use the electrical socket to power the device.I apologised to customer and explained that it was not permitted to charge the device on board the aircraft and that the device could only be used when used with batteries.Customer wanted a follow up to why it was not permittedContact details are as follows2782 411 9366joomas@yebo.co.za

CPAP PROCEDURE  During meal service, customer was observed using a CPAP device (oxygen concentrator that prevents sleep apnoea).  The device  has the FAA approval sticker, had no batteries and it was connected to the seat power socket.  Customer was informed of the protocols and condition of usage.  Customer didn't have an physician letter, hence he was requested to stow away the device.  Customer expressed that he has been using this device often when travelling with Emirates and never had an issue before.  Customer complied and the CPAP was stowed away.

Sever turbulence     As per the Captains instructions crew were asked to seat and suspend the service aprox 1.15 minutes after take off. in anticipation of severe turbulence.  No feedback was received by customers, all were understanding of safety protocol

Above occurred automatically & woke me up, I could not sleep until the wake up call.  Many more crew complained about above lighting, some were effected 3 times before wake up call.

Security video could not be played  and safety video could not be checked  Pre customer  boarding due to : Upon boarding found No Power in the CWS and also the entire Pax system switched off from the FAP.by Engineers and had left it OFF. many customers are asking for kit bags and slippers on this sector. would be highly recommended to have these Items loaded, for request only perhaps.
Mix Nuts      Customer only enjoys Cashew and Pista nuts.  Customer would like to only have these nuts available.

Rush found inside the water jug     Many other times first class crew found rush inside the water jug and therefore, the crew couldn't be able to use the water jug for the service and the hygienic reason.  It is because water jug was not dried or wiped off after use.

Lack of Slipper sizes and size medium according to most customers were too small:  3 (1E; 1F; 4K) out of 14 customers who requested for medium size slippers stated that it was too small and asked to change to a large size, however large size slippers were limited and none was left therefore unable to exchange slipper sizes.   Socks were offered however customers in suite 1E and 1F appeared unhappy that there were not able to receive the correct sizes. Customer in 4k appeared satisfied with socks and medium slippers.

First Class Full Height Suites/The Service Window The service window latches were not operating as instructed on the ACI It stated that "Pull down the window using the handle. Push down until it is latched." The latch handle was not working.
Crew member in economy cabin mistakenly spilled tomato juice (extensively) on a customer sitting at 71A.   As a service recovery, a Pyjama from first class was offered to the customer.

AC delayed on stand All customers had boarded the AC and all pre departures completed  Captain informed crew that the ac would be at stand for 15 20 minutes Decision was taken to hand out menus and wine lists to customers in FC
It is a night flight and all customer were sleeping.All customers asked for matrasses and complained that the yare unavailableSuggestion to have matrasses available on this sector.
Only 2 small vases were loaded for the both Spas. No vase loaded for the water feature.

Severe turbulence expected 2 hours before landing and during descent.I was asked by our Captain to stop all services and have the cabin fully secured at 20:15 Dubai time as severe turbulence was expected.
BREAKFAST  SERVICE Mr Rogers slept most of the flight and woke up during decent .Mr Rogers and his wife seated at 2E  both of them wanted BF during holding time due to fog .

No member from the Cleaning staff was available when we boarded the aircraft and during Customer boarding. No acknowledgment paper work was signed by myself indicating Cleaning was satisfactory. ground Dispatcher was informed.

Customer requested to have lunch only 1.5hrs prior to landing Customer stated she does this flight all the time and always allowed to make this request Purser explained that meals were already heated for a set meal service however would serve as requeste
NIL customer had the light bite option  During the light bite service none of our customers had a light bite before landed
Social Area on new B777We had problems arranging the dried fruit and snacks on the trolley as they were always falling down and would not stand up

CANAPES SERVICE FEEDBACK.  Miss Dalal ordered the canapes selection which consist of hoummous with lamb baharat, sweet potato tartlet and smoked salmon crepe .  Followed by Mushroom soup as her main course.  Canapes was served to customer however she was not happy that there was no table lay up for canapes along with the bread basket.  Miss Dalal informed me that hoummous is always served with bread and commented that she is not used to this service.
Customer was not happy as There was No French newspaper or magazine on board.

CLARIFICATION ON WELCOME DRINKS SERVICE     Crew stated there was duty paid Moet et Chandon loaded in chillers for welcome drink service and it was offered to customers. However SSQ states bars cannot be opened and also having done many Indian flights my understanding is that NO alcohol can be served on ground in India as I've not had duty paid champage loaded before.

Arabic Coffee Pot  Dallah was leaking during the Welcome Service.  Crew found out about the defect whilst the coffee was being poured for customer at 3K.  No customer nor crew was injured from the incident and no complaints received from customers.

From the service sequence, Pyjamas and kit bag had to be offered on the sector DXB BKK which was not consistent among other day flight BKK.  Customers getting off to BKK would ask again on other day flight BKK which was not available.  Customers going o
MENUS GIVEN ON GROUNDPlease be informed that menus were given on ground due to a 26 minute delay.

CUSTOMER FEED BACK during conversation customer mentioned that he has started flying with our competitors as he feels the  the value of the products and services offered to first class customers has reduced he mentioned that he noticed the items that have been removed over the years few eg he mentioned were the kit bags, the duvets and mattresses not being available on cmb sector
Ground Staff informed us to leave unused items and not to collect      Crew followed instructions
No Trolley Available in F/C   This is to highlight that after take off we came to realise that no trolley was loaded in F/C.  J/C had only two trolleys that they needed for service.
Delayed Bag Forms & Fast Track Cards    Cleaning supervisor did not provide the above forms as they normally do.

Ms Nina wanted to have some cheese  During flight  as she did not like the Food in first class .Customer stated that its one of the worst food and she paid 35K and she cant even Have some cheese .Customer Commented very low on the quality of the food and  the choice of menu featured in F class .

NO SHOWER AMENITIES LOADED   F/C        It was brought to my attention during cabin check by FG1 that none of the F/C shower amenities were loaded  No CSA amenities cart & Spas didn't have any soap as well
Crew showed me a tray that was cracked from the centre due to heavy weight of cutlery.
Customer's feedback   Mr. Sabharwal stated that he was not happy with the vodka brand change.  He stated he prefers the grey goose and that FC should always have it.

First class menus were scattered in different menu bags and took a while to find all of the menus This resulted in menus taking longer time to be given to customers Couple of F/C menus were given to J/C customers instead by mistake

Service Suggestion: 2A customer had requested caviar after take off. We were catered for breakfast and light bites. Majority of customers enjoyed Light Bites after take off as opposed to waking up for breakfast before landing. 5 of the 8 customers were c
due to flight delay, breakfast service was changed to lunch service Catering loaded Additional meals for lunch service
hollowware container containing Arabic Coffee cups and Coffee pot not loaded Arabic Coffee was verbally Offered to all customers.
Flowers on this sector must be stowed in the product audit container which is not large enough to stow all flowers without being damaged.
2 Water Jugs required   During the flight, 11 customers ate after take off. The crew had to share one water jug, and offer the water could not be poured immediately.
Unable to locate the Fast track cards  Unable to locate the fast track card for the premium customers and for the HVC in YC cabin.  Nil customers requested for it.
SSQ stated Ice cream service in the last cycle of we care for first and business class   No ice cream was loaded   2 customers in Business requested ice cream

As we are now able to serve customers hot beverages from paper cup, may I suggest that we use the ones from Y/C express breakfast service as they are thicker, thus better to protect one from getting burn from the hot liquid when holding. The lid fits pe
Arabic Coffee pot was defective with leak.

Seat Number correction   Kindly refer to y previous Kis report  Mr and Mrs Beare  (Previous Kis report Regarding  Customers Desired to have breakfast  Breakfast did not feature on the menu and were offered breakfast items of  Muesli ,cornflakes and fruits from Drystores ) Above customers were seated on 2EF .( it was typed as 1EF in Previous Kis report  by error)

service carried out on the ground   All cabins F/J/Y have carried out the food service on the ground due to lengthy delay (3:40)  food was heated on the ground as per SS   later on the flight was delayed to the second day and so on
Customer requested kit bag.Customer was not happy with the fact that its available on some sectors and not on others.

Please note that only 6 large plats were loaded with full 14 customer, while 12 base plats were loaded.If 8 customer need to eat at the same time I have to ask two of them to wait for two customer to finish eating then clean the large plats.In many occasions more than half of the cabin do eat at the same time.Please consider full flight full large plates.
PRE DEPARTURE DEVIATION  1 FG1 only arrived before the last cabin door was closed.  There was no time to finish off the towels and Arabic Coffee on ground before take off.

I was extremely impressed with Kristine.  I highlighted a few things on her Flight Performance.  But one thing that both me and Kristine did on this flight which worked really well and could be a suggestion in the future, was that Kristine asked me if s
Salad      Catering provided on small bag of leave (for salad).  The amount of leaves will only be enough to prepare 3 salads.  Customer load 7.
UNAVAILABILITY FAST TRACK CARDS Ground staff informed NIL STOCK for fast track card for Male

Shortage of Duvets and Mattresses on this flight, also Kit bags, J class Mattresses used.    There were 7 customers on this flight, however we only had two mattresses and two Duvets plus 5 blankets.  We had 3 Kit bags for ladies and 3 kit bags for gents. We had two female customers, therefore the kit bags shortage is two (male ones). The catering is return catered from Dubai, please kindly increase the above items to 200% as recently both ways are full.  I do this flight very often, and every time I face the same situation: only 100% catering which indeed we do need 200%. When I checked with the catering supervisors, they stated that this is the standard.
Deviation  Catering informed me they had no F/C table linen in stock.
having only one water carafe on the A376 cause delay in the service as the Crew member need to wait for one another to be done with the carafe.

Breakfast suggestion   All cabins  Few customers across all three cabin expressed a desire for breakfast rather than lunch for the first meal.  Many of our customers were transiting from European destinations and gave a feedback that it was too early for lunch as a first service.

Due to the design of the aircraft F/C interior, crew could not find appropriate area to place the linens whilst waiting to be used. Same was placed on the seat the entire flight as we prevented them from getting creased. Please do provide any tips if an
Subject:  Shower spa products leaking The shower spa products, i.e. shampoo, conditioner,, body wash, body moisturiser, cleanser, hand cream and hand soap were leaking.

HIGH TECHNICAL F/CMrs Jones told me that our F/C suites are high technical for her to use and to manipulate the seat and the facility .Mrs Jones slept most of the flight .Mrs Jones did not eat at all as she wants to sleep .Mrs Jones during holding time due to fog she wanted to have BF crew informed her that we can only serve her some thing light due to late request

Shortage of products   Only 2 light meals were catered for 8 first class customers . Three customers asked for steak sandwich and had to take one from business class  Salad provided were enough to make 3 salads only, had to reduce portion to serve all 4 customers requesting salad  Only 5 beverage linen were provided

VCM guidelines Kindly clarify this, as I found it confusing on this sector. I had not seen this guideline for operating with crew short for quite sometime now yet I have operated flights without L5A severally. It appears to contradict with the security guideline on board and so both CSV's could not agree. The security video as well as the alignment of the security and safety that is dated July 2017 clearly shows that if L5A is not available, then L5 position does the security search for the galley, however the VCM (operating crew short) guideline that was in the folder for this sector shows that if L5A is not available, then R2A which is CSV does the checks for the galley. This VCM guideline was published in DEC 2015. Kindly clarify which guideline to follow to avoid confusion that might arise on other flights with such CSV's.

PLEASE FORWARD THIS REPORT TO CREW SCHEDULING AS NO KIS CATEGORY AVAILABLE TO ADDRESS CREW SCHEDULINGCABIN CREW EXCEEDED FDP: CAPTAIN'S DISCRETION APPLIED13 out of 15 cabin crew ran out of FDP legality hours. This was predicted before departure from DXB. Information was communicated with both flight deck crew (Pilots have layover) prior to leaving DXB and also prior to leaving BLR.  FDP limitation was also communicated with cabin crew operations prior to leaving DXB, who in turn informed crew scheduling.  It is assumed that before starting of the journey, it was planned by operations/scheduling/pilots to send cabin crew under captain's discretion, which may be contradicting with FDP legality rules. All affected cabin crew members appeared extremely exhausted prior to landing.

Mr. Almamari was caught smoking on our flight. when Confronted, he argued that he was not smoking a cigarette however It was a pipe that he has to light up. he stated that he flies on Oman air and Qatar and nobody says anything to him regarding this. this was the first time he is being Informed that he is not allowed to smoke.

during boarding, YC Crew Advised me that the passenger was caught smoking in the lavatory immediately forward of REF! door, outboard.

customer Faisal abduljabbar was passing by the crew members when they identified   a strong cigarette smell coming from him. on the spot crew members checked the lavatory  5M and found out few cigarette aches in the floor.No cigarette joint was found.

TOILET SMOKE Soon after take off thirty minutes into the flight, crew member Mariana(453116) reported that she smelled cigarette in toilet by L5 door Six hours into the flight while crew were conducting we care, crew member Mariana observed  customer 34A leaving the toilet by L3 door inboard  Crew member investigated the toilet and smelled cigarette Crew member 34a had suspected the customer earlier on with first incident of cigarette smoke and so took the initiative to investigate the toilet by L3 door

during taxiing on departure, Crew found out that a Customer had been smoking inside one of the Toilets in Y/C. upon investigation, the Smell was very clear, No signs of detector being tampered with and the cigarette was not found.  the incident took place again after the first service, where Crew reported that another toilet is smelling of cigarette smoke, the cigarette was found in the waste bin this time. lavatory At LG3 was smelling of cigarette smoke     when the Crew went to check on the lavatory It was smelling of cigarette smoke. when the Crew went to investigate the smoke detector was not tampered with however There was a strong Smell of cigarette smoke.

on ground, Mr AlShehri was caught to have smoked in the AFT mid lavatory   during the door Arming check calls, Mr AlShehri exited the AFT mid lavatory leaving an obvious trail of tobacco Smell after himself.

During last meal service the ML5 Lav alarm was activated  Customer was found in the lavatory with smoke present when crew opened the door  No cigarette was visible and customer shouted at the crew to close the door as he was passing stool  Customer later admitted he was smoking an e cigarette
Mr Khadar Syed was smoking in the lavatory h right Hand side. smoke alarm did not activate.

The following incident was reported during the top of descent , and prior to the seat belt signs being switched on.  YC Cabin Supervisor, David ( 409316 ) reported that cigarette smoke was smelt in LAV N , in the YC lavatory .  Crew members GR2s, Tugce (406197) and Alba (454132) , had smelt smoke in the lav , thus checked the waste bin , areas behind the mirror and the surrounding areas for the source of smoke .  The crew members confirmed they had not seen any smoke .  There were nil audio visual indications in the cabin .  The smoke detector in Lav N was not tampered with , neither was it activated .  The smell of smoke had dissipated prior to arriving on the scene.

Customer claimed that he had previously been questioned by the cabin crew as to him smoking on previous flights.
